Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
Implements a Encapsulated Date object with a method to check if date is valid. The Date object holds the data for Year, Month and Day. Class has setter and getter methods because of encapsulation. The isValid() method checks if the date entered by user is correct.
Author:
Sahreb Aamir, Joshua Sennett

    • year

      private int year

    • month

    • day

      private int day

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date​(java.lang.String date)
      Constructor for Date Object with Date string parameter given. When date is passed as a string to create Date object then the year, month and day are initialized to given value.
      Parameters:
      date - String that holds the date in format mm/dd/year

    • Date

      public Date()
      Constructor for Date Object with no given parameters. When date is not passed the date object is set to the current date.

  • Method Details

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()
      Allows other classes to access value of month from Date Object.
      Returns:
      month of current Date Object in form of integer.

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Allows other classes to access value of day from Date Object.
      Returns:
      day of current Date Object in form of integer.

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Allows other classes to access value of day from Date Object.
      Returns:
      year of current Date Object in form of integer.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the Date object passed is a valid date. Checks if the date is between year 1900 and current day. Date also must have current number of days for the month it is in. Month also must be possible.
      Returns:
      true if date is credible, false if not.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Testbed to test while developing if the isValid() method works. Using different test cases it checks thoroughly the isValid() method by passing different dates to it, some valid and some not valid.
      Parameters:
      args -
